document_title: Chronic tonsillitis: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_content:
The cause of chronic tonsillitis is acute tonsillitis that is not completely treated. Repeated inflammation leads to chronic tonsillitis. Or inflammation that lasts more than 2 weeks becomes chronic.
According to MSc.BS.CKI Nguyen Thi Thuc Nhu, the most common cause of tonsillitis in adults is a weakened immune system. This will create conditions for harmful factors such as bacteria, most commonly Streptococcal, to enter the body and cause disease. There are also influenza viruses such as Herpes simplex, Parainfluenza, Epstein-Barr.
Drinking alcohol and smoking regularly also causes tonsillitis in adults to increase.
In addition, environmental factors also contribute to tonsillitis. For example, sudden weather changes, inhalation of toxic dust, and environmental pollution.
People with a history of sinusitis, adenoiditis, tooth inflammation... are also at higher risk of tonsillitis.
Accordingly, some risk factors leading to tonsillitis include:
Have a history of infectious diseases such as whooping cough, measles or respiratory diseases such as pneumonia, bronchitis...;; Poor oral hygiene;; Environmental pollution;; Eating food from unhygienic food sources. Or eat/drink cold foods like ice, ice cream...; The weather changed suddenly.
